---
title: 'Catalog queries'
description: "List catalog entries and show catalog location and summary"
---

`xorq catalog ls` and `xorq catalog info` are read-only commands with no arguments or options. Use this page to look up their output format and how catalog location is determined.

## xorq catalog ls

List all builds and aliases in the compute catalog.

### Usage

Run with no arguments.

```bash
xorq catalog ls
```

### Arguments and options

None.

### Output

The command prints two blocks. **Aliases** (if any): one line per alias with tab-separated `alias`, `entry_id`, `revision_id`. **Entries**: one line per catalog entry with tab-separated `entry_id`, `current_revision`, `build_id`.

```text
Aliases:
my-model        d32fdc18-f55b-4c15-b96b-d72c0f2727e4    r1
model-staging   1998f0ef-8798-4222-83e6-3c5773ea27c5    r1
Entries:
d32fdc18-f55b-4c15-b96b-d72c0f2727e4    r1      c2cbc2dd123f
1998f0ef-8798-4222-83e6-3c5773ea27c5    r1      c2cbc2dd123f
```

## xorq catalog info

Show the catalog file path and counts of entries and aliases.

### Usage

Run with no arguments.

```bash
xorq catalog info
```

### Arguments and options

None. Catalog location is determined by `XDG_CONFIG_HOME` (or `~/.config/xorq/catalog.yaml` if unset).

### Output

Three lines: catalog path, entry count, alias count.

```text
Catalog path: /Users/mac/.config/xorq/catalog.yaml
Entries: 2
Aliases: 2
```
